body.raw: {"article":{"title":"How to train your dragon", "description":"Ever wonder how?", "body":"Very carefully.", "tagList":["training", "dragons"]}}

item.name: All Articles with limit (articlesCount pagination check)

exec: // Core pagination test: limit=1 but total articles == 2
// articlesCount MUST be the total, not the page size
tests['articlesCount is exactly 2 (total, not page size)'] = responseJSON.articlesCount === 2;

item.name: All Articles with offset (articlesCount still total)

exec: // offset=1, limit=1 with 2 total articles: should get 1 article back, count still 2
tests['articlesCount is still 2 despite offset'] = responseJSON.articlesCount === 2;

tests['Comment body is correct'] = comment.body === 'Thank you so much!';
tests['Comment author username is correct'] = comment.author && comment.author.username === pm.globals.get('USERNAME');
tests['"createdAt" property is an ISO 8601 timestamp'] = /^\d{4,}-[01]\d-[0-3]\dT[0-2]\d:[0-5]\d:[0-5]\d.\d+(?:[+-][0-2]\d:[0-5]\d|Z)$/.test(comment.createdAt);

{"article": {"title": "Celeb article two", "description": "Second celeb article for feed pagination", "body": "Content two"}}

exec: // Feed pagination: limit=1 but celeb has 2 articles

// Verify feed content: articles come from followed celeb user
